Headline: Face-to-face encounters
Text: The mediators will invite a number of commentators and co-investigators for face-to- face encounters structured around the thorniest issues revealed in the course of the collaborative inquiry; those elements where the discrepancies between values and descriptions are most flagrant. The results of these encounters will be archived in the digital platform and subjected to various restitutions.

Headline: Conference with Bruno Latour: “Speaking Religiously about Religion?”
Text: Bruno Latour, "Speaking Religiously about Religion?", EPHE Groupe on the Sociology of Religion, September 19th, 2013

Headline: Séminaire EME à Vancouver
Site update and addition of the contributions column
Text: The new version of site is now up online (V.0.06) with the addition of fourth and final column: contributions. For the time being it is only in private mode. However, while waiting for opportunity to submit your contributions to the AIME team's mediators, you now have the possiblity to experiment with this new feature, prepare your contributions as well as add links to different documents and media files (PDFs, videos, images). A tutorial is available: here via this link. Please remember that this is only an alpha version. Please do not hesitate to send us information about any bugs that you may encounter to: contact[at]modesofexistence[dot]org. Watch this space for more information.

Headline: Day devoted the question 'What aesthetic for the sciences of Gaia?'
Text: What aesthetic for the sciences of Gaia? Part of the La Novela festival in Toulouse with Tomas Saraceno, Adam Lowe, Philippe Squarzioni, Bronislaw Szerszynski, Samuel Sighicelli, Olivier Vallet, Serge Pey, Alain Podaire, Marie Farge, Oliver Morton, Clive Hamilton and Jean-Michel Frodon. Bringing together researchers, artists and professionals from the arts this encounter is part of an ethno-sociological inquiry. It aims to find resonances in the different artistic and scientific mediums called upon in the Passions Gaia project. It also seeks to cross these different forms of expression so as to render the gravity of the various ecological issues palpable and acute, provoking both collective and individual awareness. The recording of this day wi will prove to be of immense value to the AIME project. Updates to follow.

Headline: Session with Bruno Latour, Isabelle Stengers and Didier Debaise about AIME at the ENS
Text: The AIME team along with Saverio Ansaldi, Gwenaëlle Aubry, Didier Debaise, from the CIEPFC (Centre International d’Etude de la Philosophie Française Contemporaine) organize a session with Bruno Latour and Isabelle Stengers on the Inquiry into the Modes of Existence. This session, as part of the seminar 'Problems with Metaphysics' deals more specifically with the theme 'The uses of relations' (Les usages de la relation) takes place on Friday 18 October between 5 p.m. and 7 p.m. at the ENS-Ulm, salle Cavaillès at 45, rue d'Ulm 75005 Paris. Free entry but seating is limited.

Headline: THATCamp Digital Humanities 2013, Saint-Malo, France
Text: Christophe Leclercq and Paul Girard present AIME at ThatCamp Saint-Malo, 19 October 2013. More informations on our blog.

Headline: Mediator workshop
Text: The project's mediators will be meeting in Paris to set down the details for the procedures for moderating contributions and all validated contributions will be made public from this date. The Mediation team will share the task of reviewing the contributions that you will be making from October 2014 to June 2014. Among the moderators are Bruno Latour, Milad Doueihi, Vincent Lépinay, François Cooren, Noortje Marres, Didier Debaise, Nicolas Prignot, Aline Wiame and Pierre-Laurent Boulanger. This workshop will also define the annual schedule for the events that we will be organizing that deal with the modes or the crossings shared out among the Mediators. The schedule will be published on the blog once it has been finalized. The final year of the project will be characterized by these encounters that will allow us to call upon your contributions and allow us to shed some light on those areas of the Inquiry that require some extra attention.

Headline: Workshop [REP·REF]
Text: The AIME team with the cooperation of Pablo Jensen host a workshop on the crossing of [REP·REF]. In the morning session, Bruno Latour will explain the importance of this to the 'Modes of Existence' followed Pablo Jensen who will speak about [REP·REF] and physics and Antoine Georges on 'Matter and atoms'. Livio Riboli-Sasco will give a talk on 'The living modes of existence' followed by Pierre Sonigo on 'Theories of living'. Didier Debaise will wrap up the workshop with 'The nervousness of different existences in Whitehead'. See on our blog the schedule, and the report.

Headline: Conference at Warsaw
Text: Invited by the Polish Institute of Anthropology, Bruno Latour will give a lecture on ‘How to use Occam's razor to multiply ontological templates – reflections on the Inquiry into the Modes of Existence’ - 8 November 2013, 4 p.m. The auditorium, Old University Library, University of Warsaw. For more information here.

Headline: Colloquium on 'Political decisions and truth'.
Text: Bruno Latour will speak at the colloquium 'Political decisions and truth'. For more information please go to: ici, and more specifically to: Detailed program.

Headline: Presentation of the IME project at the Annual Meeting Central of the'American Anthropological Association (Chicago)
Text: An invitation by the 'American Anthropological Association to present the IME project. There will also be a discussion with Philippe Descola who will be presenting his book Beyond Nature and Culture.

Headline: Presentation of the IME project at Ma(n)chines, HKW, Berlin
Text: Pierre-Laurent Boulanger presents the IME project at Ma(n)chines, HKW, Berlin. More informations on our blog.

Headline: Questions & Answers n°1 at Sciences Po Paris
Text: The AIME team organize a Q&A session that will treat the theoretical and practical issues that you may have come across. We invite you to an informal gathering that will take place in the Erignac amphitheater at 13 rue de l’Université, Paris on Monday, 9 December between 5:30 and 7:30 p.m. Free entry but limited places available. For more information please go to this blog post.

Headline: [POL] workshop at Goldsmith University, London
Text: Hosted by CSISP (Gold­smiths)-Modes of Ex­is­tence (Sci­ences Po), this one day event is ded­icated to test­ing the modes of pol­i­tics as iden­ti­fied in Bruno La­tour’s Modes of Ex­is­tence and re­lated lit­er­a­ture. The over­ar­ch­ing aim of the work­shop is to pro­duce fur­ther qual­i­fica­tions of these modes of pol­i­tics, by means of em­pir­i­cal in­ves­ti­ga­tion of se­lected ma­teri­als. See on our blog the scope, the schedule, the report by Bruno Latour and by David Moats

Headline: Conference in Athens by Bruno Latour at the Cycladic Art Museum
Text: Conference in Athens by Bruno Latour at the Cycladic museum at 7pm on how the AIME project could bear on economic crisis of the Greek magnitude. More information here or on our blog.

Headline: Presentation of the AIME Project at IRI, Paris
Text: Christophe Leclercq will give a presentation of the site for An Inquiry into Modes of Existence at the l’Institut de Recherche et d’Innovation (IRI) 2013-2014 seminar, “Digital Writing and Editing,” during their session entitled “Annotation: Knowledge in the Margin.”. More informations on our blog.

Headline: [MET·REF] workshop in Paris
Text: A working session with Tobie Nathan, Philippe Pignarre, Antoine Hennion, Allan and Janet Tobin, members of the Dingdingdong collective. The aim is to bring out the differences between the beings of metamorphisis [MET] and those called reference [REF], so as to work towards a formulation of ontological pluralism suited to the inquriry that will be understandable and acceptable to psychiatrists. That is, a more diplomatic formulation of the eternal "Mind/Body" problem. See on our blog the schedule, and the report.

Headline: Research Seminar on Anthropological Theory (LSE, London)
Text: Bruno Latour speaks at the Research Seminar on Anthropological Theory at the LSE and presents the Inquiry into the Modes of Existence. For more information please click here.

Headline: Presentation of the AIME project at the Copenhagen Business School (CBS)
Text: The team will present the AIME project from 3:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. at the Copenhagen Business School (CBS), in Denmark. For more information please visit our blog by clicking on this link

Headline: [ATT] workshop at the Copenhagen Business School (CBS)
Text: The AIME team have organized a workshop dealing with [ATT] at the Copenhagen Business School (CBS) on Tuesday the 25th (all day) and Wednesday the 26th (morning) with our mediator Vincent Lépinay. See on our blog the call for contributions, the schedule, and the report.

Headline: Public lecture at the Royal Dan­ish Acad­emy of Sci­ences and Let­ters, Copenhagen
Text: On Wednesday 26 February 2014 at 17.00, Bruno Latour gives a lecture (The Affects of Capitalism) at the Royal Library, The Black Diamant. Registration for the lecture opens on 31 January 2014. More information here"_blank">on our blog.

Headline: A conference on Gaia, An­thro­pol­ogy and the Law at McGill University.
Text: Bruno La­tour, came to the Fac­ulty of Law (McGill Uni­ver­sity, Mon­treal) to speak on 'Gaia, An­thro­pol­ogy and the Law'. More information here.

Headline: [ORG] workshop with François Cooren
Text: A workshop on the mode of existence [ORG] at the University of Montreal organized by our mediator François Cooren. See on our blog the scope, the schedule, and the report.

Headline: Workshop on the anthropological dimension of IME at the McGill University, Montreal
Text: A workshop on the anthropological dimension of IME at McGill University with Richard Janda, Eduardo Kohn and Peter Skafish. See on our blog the schedule, and the report.

Headline: Tanner Lectures and IME workshop at Yale
Text: The 2014 Tanner lectures at Yale have been given by Bruno Latour the 26th and 27th of March 2014 on the question of agency. They have been followed by a round table on the AIME project chaired by Daniel Kevles with Joanna Radin, Philip Gorski and Adam Tooze.

Headline: Conference on "Governance and the digital revolution" at Lyon.
Text: The aim of this day of reflection and debate, organized by Pablo Jensen around the theme of the digital revolutions, is to better understand the changes taking place in the relations between governments and the governed as well as those between nations. With Bruno Latour, Benoît Thieulin, president of the Conseil National du Numérique, Nicolas Colin, inspector of public finances and author of a report on the tax system and the digital economy, and Stéphane Grumbach, a researcher at the INRIA and specialist on political data. Amphithéâtre Descartes, at the ENS, Lyon. More information here.

Headline: Semiotics seminar (first session)
Text: Invited by the co-organizers of the seminar on semiotics from l'Université Paris IV – La Sorbonne, l'université de Limoges and l'Université Paris 8, Bruno La­tour will be participating the 9 April and the 7 May 2014. His first talk entitled "The Inquiry into the Modes of Existence project: an empirical test of the ontological dimensions of semiotics" followed by a talk by Patrice Maniglier ("Latour and the sign"). For more information please visit our blog.

Headline: Presentation of the AIME Project at La Gaîté Lyrique
Text: Donato Ricci and Robin de Mourat present the AIME project and its implications for design in the digital humanities during the conference and exhibition "Écran - Mobile- Butor" at La Gaité Lyrique, conceived by Margot Baran, Jordane Cals, Eléonore Jasseny, Alice Jauneau and Lorène Ceccon, under the direction of Dominique Cunin, École supérieur d'art et design de Valence, in 2013-2014. For more information see our blog.

Headline: [REP] workshop with Didier Debaise and the GECo
Text: Taking advantage of the 'Rare events in biology' summer school, the AIME research project is running a working meeting at the same place in parallel over two days on the 16 and 17 April on one of the most delicate aspects of the Inquiry. Coming from the sociology of science and the philosophy of nature as well as physics and biology, the participants will be embarking on a new tentative to untangle separate modes (particularly those of reproduction and reference) the confusion over which causes biologists (and to a lesser degree physicists) a great number of fundamental problems. See on our blog the schedule and the report.

Headline: [LAW] workshop with Kyle McGee in Paris
Text: The aim of this workshop organized by Bruno Latour and Kyle McGee is to collect documents and arguments capable of improving the account of law that is put forward in the rewritten Inquiry, as well as to better appreciate law as a unique mode of existence and veridiction. To that end, the participants are encouraged to come prepared to contribute material that may inform our collective experiment in re-evaluating the means (and the ends) of law. Sciences Po Paris, 13 rue de l’Université 75007. See on our blog the schedule and the report.

Headline: Workshop Let's Calculate: Reinventing Accounting with Bruno Latour? Paris
Text: This work­shop, or­ga­nized in Sciences Po, Paris by Mar­tin Gi­raudeau & Vin­cent Lépinay, aims at un­der­stand­ing, dis­cussing and even­tu­ally fur­ther­ing this new, rad­i­cal cri­tique of ac­count­ing. See the call for contributions, the schedule and the report.

Headline: Bruno Latour participates at the conference 'Religion and pluralities of knowledge', University of Groningen, Netherlands
Text: Invited by the organizers of the seminar on "Religion and Pluralities of Knowledge" (University of Groningen, 11-15 May 2014), Bruno La­tour will be participating the 12 May 2014 as one of the keynote speakers, with a talk entitled "Beyond Belief: On the Forms of Knowledge Proper to Religious Beings". For more information please visit our blog.

Headline: Semiotics seminar (second session)
Text: Invited by the co-organizers of the seminar on semiotics from l'Université Paris IV – La Sorbonne, l'université de Limoges and l'Université Paris 8, Bruno La­tour will be participating the 9 April and the 7 May 2014. The title of the second talk will be "Can we use semiotics as a metalanguage for capturing the differences between the modes of existence?" Pablo Fabbri will give a talk on "Efficient enactments: tactics and de-ontology". See on our blog the call for contributions, the schedule, and the report.

Headline: [REL] workshop with Milad Doueihi in Paris
Text: Mi­lad Doueihi is organizing the [REL] workshop on religion at Sciences Po (13 rue de l’uni­ver­sité 75007, Paris, salle du con­seil), on Wednesday 21 and Thursday 22 May 2014 (9:30-17:30). We are focusing specifically on the crossings [POL·REL] and [FIC·REL]. See on our blog the call for contributions, the schedule and the report.

Headline: Bruno Latour gives a speech at the Catholic University of Louvain
Text: Bruno Latour speaks at a seminar on epistemology and the social sciences at the 'Université catholique de Louvain, June 6 2014, from 10:15 a.m. to 12:15 p.m around the subject of the  modes of existence. Université Catholique de Louvain - Place de l’Université, 1 – 1348 Louvain-la-Neuve, Salle Oleffe, Halles Universitaires (a.438). For more information: bfrereATulg.ac.be

Headline: [FIC·ATT] workshop with Patrice Maniglier in Paris
Text: The meeting on the 18th June will be addressed to two modes of existence [FIC] for ‘fiction’ and [ATT] for ‘attachment’. The job will be to highlight the controversies that proliferate around questions of art and economy as a field of observation that can capture or detect the differences between two modes of reality, which we are equally attached to, and which we want to be able to make compatible, but which until now have been described in such a way that conflict between them is inevitable. See on our blog the call for contributions, the schedule and the report.

Headline: Workshop with Armin Linke and his students
Text: We had the pleasure of welcoming Armin Linke's students from the Staatliche Hochschule für Gestaltung Karlsruhe (HFG, Karlsruhe), who have been working with us for almost two years, so that they could add the finishing touches to their visual contributions ((photo and film). To find out more, you can go and see the results on our blog.

Headline: IME seminar in Brussels
Text: The AIME team is invited to participate in the latest in a series of seminars organized by François Thoreau and Ariane d'Hoop, dedicated the modes of existence. To find out more, go to our blog and take a look at the programme and the summary.

Headline: Keynote address by Bruno Latour at DH2014, Lausanne
Text: Bruno Latour delivers a keynote entitled "Rematerializing Humanities Thanks to Digital Traces" at DH 2014, 5 p.m., Tuesday 8 July.

Headline: Diplomatic Writing Workshop
Text: The diplomatic writing workshops will summarize the project's three years of objections, revisions, and additions in order to draft a "spec-book" (cahier des charges), which will be submitted during the Final Evaluation Conference by the diplomats (chargés d'affaires). Organized with the Centre de sociologie de l'innovation (École des Mines). See the draft document (schedule) on our blog.

Headline: AIME Final Evaluation Conference
Text: The project will come to a close with a two day colloquium: an evaluation conference provisionally concluding the project with diplomats (or chargé d'affaires : Barbara Cassin, Eduardo Viveiros de Castro, Deborah Danowski, Annemarie Mol, Peter Weibel, Simon Schaffer, Clive Hamilton; and Dipesh Chakrabarty via videoconference). See on our blog the schedule and the video.

Headline: Extension of the AIME Project!
Text: We are happy to announce that the ERC has granted us a ten month extension, which will allow us to continue the work of the inquiry and expand further on the work that has been accomplished (drum roll please!) until the end of June 2015.

Headline: German Edition of the Inquiry
Text: The publication of the German edition (Suhrkamp) of An Inquiry into Modes of Existence under the title: Existenzweisen - Eine Anthropologie der Modernen. More information on our blog

Headline: Presentation of the AIME Project at the Digital Intelligence 2014 colloquium
Text: Robin de Mourat speaks on the 18th of September 2014 at the Digital Intelligence 2014 colloqiuium (Nantes, France) to present the stakes of our publication for the field of Digital Humanities. More Information on our Blog.

Headline: The Thousand Names of Gaïa, Rio de Janeiro
Text: From the 15th to the 19th of September an important symposium gathered people who have worked on the politics of the Anthropocene. The symposium is curated by Eduardo Viveiros de Castro and Deborah Danowski - who are also the authors of a very important paper (in fact a small book) on the different versions of the end of the world. More Information on our Blog.

Headline: Gaia Intrudes: a Public Lecture
Text: Bruno Latour presents Gaia Intrudes followed by a conversation with Prof. Nicholas Lemann on Monday, Sept. 22 at 5:30 p.m. on Furnald Lawn, Front of Pulitzer Hall.

Headline: AIME/Latour Faculty Workshop, Columbia Journalism School, New York
Text: A faculty colloquium to discuss with Professor Latour his latest book, An Inquiry Into Modes of Existence: An Anthropology of the Moderns [Harvard 2013]. Wednesday, Sep. 24, 2014, 12:00 pm (Brown Institute for Media Innovation). More Information on our Blog.

Headline: Lecture on "Sensus communis" [FIC·REF], MIT
Text: Lecture on the two aesthetics of arts and sciences [FIC·REF], at CAST Symposium Seeing / Sounding / Sensing on Friday, September 26, 2014 - 1:30 – 4:00pm & 5:00–7:00pm. More information on our blog.

Headline: THATCamp Digital Humanities 2014, Lyon, France
Text: We are present at ThatCamp on the 15th and 16th of October, and propose a workshop on the project, An Inquiry into Modes of Existence, in collaboration with Nicolas Thély from the Rennes 2 University.More information on our blog.

Headline: Dialogue on Religion [REL]
Text: Former Archbishop of Canterbury Lord Williams of Oystermouth and Bruno Latour lead a discussion on the role of religion in society within the context of escalating environmental crisis. This took place in the Faith Centre. More information on our blog.

Headline: Bruno Latour presents AIME in Buenos Aires
Text: Bruno Latour presents AIME on Tuesday, Nov. 4 at 6:00 p. m. (Fondation OSDE, Buenos Aires). More informations here.

Headline: Bruno Latour at the NLF: “Ce que le numérique fait aux humanités”
Text: Bruno Latour speaks at the National Library of France (Site François-Mitterand, Petit auditorium - hall Est) Wednesday, November 19, 2014 (18:30-20:00) with a lecture entitiled “Ce que le numérique fait aux humanités,” as a part of the Grandes conférences Del Duca - Institut de France. More information on our blog.

Headline: Some Interpretive Tools for Data Collected from AIME
Text: Robin de Mourat will present certain elements of a case study performed on EME. To form a better grasp of this strange object and approach it under different analytical points of view, he has conducted different experiments with formatting the data collected during his study (data on navigation, questionnaires, interviews) with regard to its design and the development of tools for navigating and using the site. More information on our blog.

Headline: An Exhibition project at the ZKM, in Karlsruhe (Germany)
Text: We have just returned from Karlsruhe (Germany) where we met the ZKM team to prepare an exhibition that will start in April 2016. We consider this exhibition as a great opportunity and a fourth medium to experiment with the inquiry along with the book, the platform and the face-to-face meetings we’ve done so far. A first statement of intent on our blog.

Headline: Another Aesthetics for Another Earth', CAOS, London
Text: Lecture on 'Another Aesthetics for Another Earth' by Bruno latour at the UCL Department of Anthropology and Centre for the Anthropology of Sustainability (CAOS), London. More informations here.

Headline: Seminar - The political theology of nature. Encounter with Bruno Latour, Convent de la Tourette
Text: Discussion with Bruno Latour hosted by Christophe Boureux, Dominicain et theologiain joined by other speakers on the subject of : "The anthropology of the Moderns sure of themselves on the enigmatic figure of Gaïa, the sudden intrusion of ecological mutations that lead us to live on a planet understood differently depending on those of modes of existence that are yet to be invented.” More information on our blog.

Headline: Presentation by Robin de Mourat on his research into the AIME project
Text: Robin de Mourat presents the results of his research into the AIME project at 6:30 p.m. at the Paillasse, as part of a session on academic research practices. Address: La Paillasse Paris, 226 rue Saint Denis, 75002 Paris, France.

Headline: Joachim Thomsen & Thomas Nyrup join the AIME team!
Text: Joachim Thomsen & Thomas Nyrup just join the AIME team to work on analyzing different experiences and perceptions of co-inquirers, mediators and the AIME team. More information on our blog.

Headline: Theatrical conference held by Bruno Latour: The Anthropocene: a new era marked by human activity. Quai Branly Museum.
Text: A theatrical conference by Bruno Latour and the theatre company AccenT at the Quai Branly Museum as part of the Grandes Conférences (The Anthropocene: a new era marked by human activity), Saturday 14 March 2015, 2:30 p.m. For more information, please go to our blog.

Headline: Conference held by Bruno Latour in Utrecht: 'How to Sort out the Many Ambiguities of the Concept of Anthropocene
Text: Bruno Latour spoke at Utrecht University, 18 April, 2015, with a lecture entitled 'How to Sort out the Many Ambiguities of the Concept of Anthropocene'. More information on our blog.

Headline: Study day: "Semiotics and the Anthropology of the Moderns", Limoges
Text: This day for reflection will investigate the encounter between the semiotic project, that revindicating its place among the social sciences and humanities, also attempts to forge a conceptual apparatus capable of translating this orientation and, the vast anthropology of the Moderns as elaborated by Bruno Latour in the Inquiry into the Modes of Existence published in 2012. At the Faculté des Lettres et des Sciences Humaines, Petit Amphi. For more information please visit our blog.

Headline: Meeting on Carl Schmitt's Nomos of the Earth
Text: The AIME project is organizing an informal meeting on Carl Schmitt's Nomos of the Earth with geographers, a theologian, two historians of art and two philosophers, which will take place on May 4th from 9am to 6pm (Sciences Po Paris). The speakers will be Claudio Minca and Rory Rowan (geographers), Kenneth Olwig (geographer and art historian), Joseph Koerner (art historian), Michael Northcott (theologian), Bruno Karsenti and Dorothea Heinz (philosophers), Noah Feldman and Pierre Yves Condé (law), and Bruno Latour (anthropologist). They will explore how Nomos could be used to rethink the politics of ecology and the new questions of sovereignty of territories. If you are interested in participating please send a message to barbara.bender@sciences.po.fr

Headline: Make it Work/ The Theater of Negotiations, Nanterre
Text: The delegations are coming to Amandiers first test of AIME inspired geopolitics: the Parliament of Things assembled. More information on our blog.
